title: Do you think that in life, we cannot take anything for granted? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, we all are mortal. All of us, so that makes us by nature having to fulfill the: Maslow’s Window Box, (it has other names too). That is all men need: Food, water, etc to survive at the basic levelSafety from the elements and predatorsBecause we are social beings, we need companion ship of othersThe last and often the hardest to obtain is self fulfillment/self worthSo this is why we take things for “granted” so often. We get caught up in working so we can pay our bills, making commitments to others we can barely keep, etc. What to do? Make time for yourself to “smell the roses.” Simple but often harder to do than most people think…

Yes, you can take anything in life for granted as you have the ability to. The result of this is not known and will, most likely due to the unpredictable nature of life, have some detrimental effect on your life. Since you have the free will to do something though, doesn’t mean that you should. It is in your interests and reason to willingly choose whether or not you wish to take anything for granted or not. Hope this helps.
